title: Hotel and Resort News: Fresh Produce in Florida; Champagne in London
text:
Our Tuesday morning hotel and resort digest, with deals, tips and anything else that travelers may want to know.
AT NAPLES RITZ-CARLTON, A FARM VERY CLOSE TO THE TABLE
The Ritz-Carlton, Naples in Florida has an innovative new source for its vegetables: The resort recently purchased a 45-foot-long repurposed shipping container that has the capacity to grow an acre of produce.
Called the Grow House, the container is the result of a partnership with Williamson Greenhouses in North Carolina and uses a hydroponic vertical growing system, which consumes 90 percent less water than a traditional farm or garden of equal size. .
The resort’s executive chef, George Fistrovich, is currently growing mostly lettuces inside it such as bibb, romaine, arugula and butter, though cilantro, spinach, cabbage and micro-greens are also part of the mix.
